title: error: internal compiler error:  drop of untracked, uninitialized value

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code The panic happens here https://github.com/sigmaSd/konster/blob/ice/src/kmap.rs#L16 ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.57.0 (f1edd0429 2021-11-29) binary: rustc commit-hash: f1edd0429582dd29cccacaf50fd134b05593bd9c commit-date: 2021-11-29 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.57.0 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir_transform/src/elaborate_drops.rs:315:25: drop of untracked, uninitialized value bb8, place (((_1.0: kvec::KVec<(K, V), N>).0: [(K, V); N])[_22].1: V) (Parent(Some(mp32))) ```
Backtrace
